job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Tarpon Springs, FL

job_title: Registered Nurse in Tarpon Springs, FL
pros: Pay. Benefits. Food. That’s about it. Literally. Work life balance sucks. They give you all the bells and whistles to shade the danger that is this corrupted hospital. Adventhealth as a whole is probably fine. But this location needs to be shut down. But cannot be because they are with the church.
cons: Management, administration, care planning, physicians, drama, word of mouth, patients literally go to this hospital to die. Doctors come on a camera and diagnose patients without ever seeing them.

job_title: Radiology in Tarpon Springs, FL

job_title: Lab Generalist in Pinellas Park, FL

job_title: Registered Cardiovascular Invasive Specialist in Tarpon Springs, FL
pros: Best overall Cath Lab experience. Best staff environment. Best Management. Great relocation & sign-on...
cons: Relatively low hourly pay to start; although they are getting better. Considering the cost of living expense within call range, it will be hard to live here once the sign-on/relocation stuff is over. Call pay could also be better.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Tarpon Springs, FL
pros: you get to help people if you really want to.
cons: admin is very hard to deal with regarding employee needs as far as needing more employees/cleanliness its horrible and managers do not care about it . it is more of a come in do your job the least amount you can at least then leave.

job_title: Registered Nurse in New Port Richey, FL
pros: Caring, Good Staffing Ratios, Great work/life balance

job_title: Registered Nurse in Tarpon Springs, FL
pros: Amazing clinical outcomes and culture. Many renovations taking place to update the facility and reflect the great things going on at AHNP.

job_title: Director of Finance in Tarpon Springs, FL
pros: The people and mission here are fantastic. The clinical care here is exceptional, they have been recognized by CMS as a 5 star care facility.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Tarpon Springs, FL

job_title: Registered Nurse in Tarpon Springs, FL
pros: You will get a paycheck and it was close to home.
cons: You better make sure you are healthy and cancer free because they have ZERO compassion on new people, especially ANYONE with health problems or disabilities.  They will let you go for any little thing but try to make it because of something legal.  They need to be investigated by Eight on your Side asap. They brag that they are a Christian company but are far from it.  The trainers belittle you in front of others, and have those who are not qualified supervise which should be illegal.  They do not use their job descriptions appropriately.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Tarpon Springs, FL
pros: AHNP truly has an amazing work environment from an active leadership to  a family atmosphere for employees. Leadership is visible, listens to its employees and advocates for what’s best for patients, families, caregivers and staff.   The team work is great!  When you say you want to find a second family you will find that here with this facility. The culture here allows a nurse to be a nurse, it’s not just about the numbers.  A GREAT place to work!
cons: Nothing to say. Leadership continues to positively improve this organization.

review_title: No I do not recommend this place to work
job_title: Staff RN in Tarpon Springs, FL
pros: Fair wages and overtime available if you want it. Most of the Managers seem nice, but  they seem desperate for staff, so I've seen no disciplinary actions when needed.
cons:
very cliquey place to work, small place too. the patients are assigned completely unfairly, if  you are buddies with the charge nurse you will get  easy patients, while the rest are given to others. Self scheduling software is available, but for the most part they do not use it.
(it's 2019, use your scheduling software). Some of the units still have carpeting. The patients repeatedly complain about how unprofessional the staff is, swearing in the hallways etc. ...  a LOT of nurses or techs have long fake nails, it's against policy, patients mention it, though no one appears to care.I am looking for another job, I do not recommend this place.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Tarpon Springs, FL
pros: This is an amazing place to work! They really believe in caring for patients like they are their own family. The CNO is amazing. She frequently visits the departments and truly cares if you have any concerns. I can honestly say I haven’t looked at a job board in over 5 years. This organization truly cares about their employees!!!
cons: A little far from my house but I make the drive because of the people!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Tarpon Springs, FL
pros: Ive worked for FHNP for 7 years now and since AHS took over there have been great improvements. Upper management is very approachable and caring. It has a small hospital feel with advanced  care and knowledge caring staff . I can only see it getting even better as time goes on. New staff equipment and good doctors make this a great place to work.
cons: Sometimes we are slow in summer months but even that is improving.

job_title: Analyst in Tampa, FL
pros: Engaged Admin team. Caring staff. All departments work together to serve the community and our patients. New developments at this hospital are exciting! From CEO to staff member, the entire team is empowered and I love to come to work every day.
cons: How can there be cons for a hospital like this. You have to come and see for yourself. Working anywhere else is your con.

job_title: RN Pacu in Tarpon Springs, FL

job_title: Med Tech in Tarpon Springs, FL
pros: They really care about their employees. Small staff means everyone knows me and I feel like I'm part of a hospital wide team. My opinion counts and I get to participate in decision making in my department.
cons: Not a lot of room for advancement

job_title: Materials Technician in Tarpon Springs, FL
pros: Health benefits are somewhat okay.
cons: Poor decision making from top to bottom has left this department working harder than it should. Taking on other department's responsibilities for the sake of cost savings. Terrible software makes your job experience a headache. You have to truck supplies to the hospital (if it makes it there) and one truck does not have the proper lift installed. They implemented a two bin system which is very sloppy and time consuming. Leadership fails to discipline lazy coworkers.

job_title: Office Manager in New Port Richey, FL
pros: The staff I supervised was wonderful

job_title: Staff RN in Tarpon Springs, FL
